labels.label: Consulting
labels.rationale: Management consulting, strategy firms, operations consulting, IT consulting, and advisory services where the primary business is advising other organizations on strategy, operations, finance, technology, or transformation.

labels.label: Consumer Packaged Goods
labels.rationale: Companies that produce and sell branded consumer products (food, beverages, personal care, household goods) typically distributed through retail channels; brand management and product marketing roles are common MBA paths.

labels.label: Energy
labels.rationale: Oil & gas, utilities, renewable energy, power generation, energy infrastructure, energy trading, and companies primarily involved in producing or distributing energy.

labels.label: Financial Services: Hedge/Mutual Fund
labels.rationale: Asset management firms managing pooled investment funds (hedge funds, mutual funds, ETFs) where the core function is active portfolio management and securities investment.

labels.label: Financial Services: IB
labels.rationale: Investment banks focused on M&A advisory, capital raising (equity and debt underwriting), restructuring, and corporate finance advisory services.

labels.label: Financial Services: Invsmt Mgmt
labels.rationale: Traditional investment management firms managing assets for institutions or individuals (excluding hedge funds if separately categorized); includes portfolio management and asset allocation firms.

labels.label: Financial Services: Vent Cap/Priv Eqty
labels.rationale: Venture capital and private equity firms investing directly in private companies, growth equity, leveraged buyouts, and startup funding.

labels.label: Financial Services
labels.rationale: Banks, insurance companies, fintech firms primarily offering financial products, commercial lending, credit services, payments, and diversified financial institutions not better classified under a more specific financial category.

labels.label: Government
labels.rationale: Federal, state, local, or international government agencies and public authorities; includes regulatory bodies and public policy organizations where employment is within the public sector.

labels.label: Hospitality/Tourism
labels.rationale: Hotels, resorts, travel companies, airlines, cruise lines, tourism operators, and businesses centered on travel and guest services.

labels.label: Manufacturing
labels.rationale: Companies primarily engaged in producing physical goods at scale (industrial equipment, automotive, electronics hardware, consumer products) where operations, production, and supply chain are core functions.

labels.label: Media/Entertainment
labels.rationale: Television, film, streaming platforms, publishing, digital media, music, gaming, and content production companies where content creation and distribution are the primary business.

labels.label: Not For Profit/Education
labels.rationale: Nonprofit organizations, foundations, NGOs, charities, and educational institutions (universities, schools) where the core mission is public benefit rather than profit.

labels.label: Other Industry
labels.rationale: Use when the company operates in a clearly defined industry that does not fit any listed category and does not align cleanly with finance, technology, retail, or other specified sectors.

labels.label: Other Services
labels.rationale: Professional or business services firms not covered under consulting or financial services (e.g., staffing firms, facilities management, specialized service providers).

labels.label: Pharma/Biotech/Healthcare
labels.rationale: Pharmaceutical companies, biotech firms, hospitals, healthcare providers, medical device manufacturers, and healthcare services organizations.

labels.label: Real Estate
labels.rationale: Real estate development, property management, REITs, commercial real estate brokerage, and real estate investment firms where property ownership or development is the core business.

labels.label: Retail
labels.rationale: Companies that sell goods directly to consumers through physical stores or e-commerce platforms, excluding manufacturers unless retail is the primary business model.

labels.label: Technology/Telecom
labels.rationale: Software companies, SaaS providers, IT services, cloud infrastructure firms, telecommunications providers, hardware technology companies, and digital platforms.

labels.label: Transportation & Logistics Services
labels.rationale: Freight carriers, logistics providers, supply chain services, shipping companies, warehousing and distribution firms where moving goods or managing logistics is the core function.
